hotspots.hotspot:
Woodpecker finch

The beak of the woodpecker finch allows the finch to pick up twigs or cactus spines, which it uses as a tool to gather grubs.

Large ground finch

This large ground finch has a crushing beak that it uses to crush seeds. The finch also eats ticks that it removes from tortoises and iguanas.

Cactus finch

This cactus finch has a large, probing beak that allows the finch to eat small insects from the flower. It also eats the fruit of the cactus.

Warbler finch

The warbler finch has a smaller beak than any of the other Galápagos finches. It uses the beak to probe for small insects.

Vegetarian finch

The beak of the vegetarian finch is short and thickâ€”good for crushing fruits and seeds. It will also sometimes eat an occasional insect.
